Generation II.Gold: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.
Generation II.Silver: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
Generation II.Crystal: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pok é mon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
Generation III.Sapphire: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pok é mon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
Generation III.Emerald: Jumpluff ride warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. This Pok é mon lands when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
Generation III.FireRed: It drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.

Generation IV.Diamond: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
Generation IV.Pearl: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
Generation IV.Platinum: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores--it can even float around the world.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.

Generation VI.X: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
Generation VI.Y: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
Generation IX.Violet: Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, you'll be racked with coughs and itchiness.

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Safari Zone (tall grass in Marshland with 5 Plains points; Surfing in Marshland with 10 Waterside points)
